definition: brokerage/a commission paid to a middleman/euphemism for a bribe/a kickback
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)

to fasten/to button/button/buckle/knot/to arrest/to confiscate/to deduct (money)/discount/to knock/to smash, spike or dunk (a ball)/to cover (with a bowl etc)/(fig.) to tag a label on sb/(Tw) (loanword) code

sentences.english: The boss demanded a kickback on her wages.
sentences.chinese: 老闆要從她的薪金中拿走回扣。

sentences.english: Tom got a lot of kickback in the awarding contract.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆在承包大宗工程當中收取了大量的回扣。

sentences.english: It is against law to get kickbacks in USA.
sentences.chinese: 在美國拿回扣是違法行爲。

sentences.english: The salesman got a ＄50 commission for every car he sold.
sentences.chinese: 這個推銷員每銷售一輛汽車得到50美元的回扣。

sentences.english: Seller agree cancellation with allowance 2% of order value.
sentences.chinese: 賣方同意取消，願付貨款的百分之二作爲回扣。

sentences.english: Don't take kickback for the stadium project.
sentences.chinese: 別在這個體育場項目中拿回扣。

sentences.english: Solicitation, payment or receipt of bribes, gratuities or kickbacks.
sentences.chinese: 索取，支付或收受賄賂，賞金或回扣。

sentences.english: Shop owner said, can not return because carpentry has taken kickbacks. Ms.
sentences.chinese: 商店老闆說，不能退貨，因爲木工已經拿了回扣。

sentences.english: If the order can be accepted, we'll pay the kickback and commission to you.
sentences.chinese: 如果這個訂單能成的話，我們可以給你回扣和佣金。

sentences.english: I've involuntarily accepted a large amount of rebate from a company.
sentences.chinese: 我身不由己，從一家公司收受了一大筆回扣。

sentences.english: The suspicion is that €8m in kickback payments were made.
sentences.chinese: 嫌疑就是有人拿了800萬美元的回扣。

sentences.english: You are not allowed to get any commissions from the clients.
sentences.chinese: 不允許你從客戶那裏拿任何回扣。

sentences.english: Everyone who paid will receive a kickback.
sentences.chinese: 每一個交了錢的人部可以得到回扣。

sentences.english: Chinese officials don't take kick backs, do they?????
sentences.chinese: 誰敢說中國的官員們沒有拿回扣？

sentences.english: The main form of commercial bribery is kickback .
sentences.chinese: 回扣是商業賄賂的主要表現形式。

sentences.english: One of the reasons for this is a rebate program second to none.
sentences.chinese: 原因之一，因爲這是一種回扣程式無出其右。

definition: to fabricate excuses (idiom)/to concoct various items (e.g. to pad an expense account)
to exact bribes/to solicit bribes/to demand bribes/to extort
to stuff one's pockets/to take bribes
to be reimbursed for actual expenses
(coll.) to gain profit (usu. by underhand means)
to buy or sell on credit/outstanding account/to have an outstanding account
lit. wool comes from the sheep's back (idiom); One gets the benefit, but the price has been paid./Nothing comes for free.
pinyin: yang2 mao2 chu1 zai4 yang2 shen1 shang4
